src:
Bantah ICW, PDIP Tegaskan Jokowi Serius Ungkap Kasus Novel
04 Nov 2019, 07:10 by Ibnu Hariyanto
Jakarta - PDIP membela Presiden Joko Widodo yang dinilai tidak serius mengusut kasus penyiraman air keras terhadap penyidik KPK Novel Baswedan karena tenggat waktu pengungkapan ditunda. PDIP memastikan Jokowi sangat serius mengungkap kasus itu.
"Penugasan adalah penugasan, perintah adalah perintah. Jadi sangat serius," kata Politikus PDIP Hendrawan Supratikno saat dihubungi, Minggu (3/11/2019).
Hendrawan mengatakan proses penyelidikan kasus tersebut cukup rumit. Menurutnya, bukti-bukti yang didapatkan harus benar-benar akurat bukan sekadar gosip atau asumsi.
"Memang proses penyelidikannya rumit. Tidak bisa didasarkan pada asumsi atau gosip. Banyak pihak telah dimintai keterangan. Semua petunjuk awal sudah diteliti," ucapnya.
Ia mengaku mendapat informasi jika memang masih banyak hal yang harus dipastikan kebenarannya. Ia meminta semua pihak mempercayakan pengusutan kasus tersebut kepada polisi.
"Saya dengar masih ada mata rantai yang belum clear. Kita harus beri kepercayaan kepada Polri untuk menuntaskannya," tuturnya.

text:
Denied ICW, PDIP Affirms Jokowi is Seriously Revealing Novel Case
Nov 04 2019, 07:10 by Ibnu Hariyanto
Jakarta - PDIP defended President Joko Widodo, who was judged not to be serious in investigating the case of hard watering on KPK investigators Novel Baswedan because the disclosure deadline was postponed. PDIP confirmed that Jokowi was very serious about uncovering the case.
"Assignment is an assignment, an order is an order. So it is very serious," said PDIP politician Hendrawan Supratikno when contacted on Sunday (3/11/2019).
Hendrawan said the process of investigating the case was quite complicated. According to him, the evidence obtained must be absolutely accurate not just gossip or assumptions.
"Indeed, the investigation process is complex. It cannot be based on assumptions or gossip. Many parties have been questioned. All initial instructions have been investigated," he said.
He claimed to get information if there were still many things that had to be confirmed. He asked all parties to entrust the investigation of the case to the police.
"I hear there are links that are not yet clear. We have to give trust to the National Police to complete them," he said.
